task.title: Deleting a destination mapping rule by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can delete a destination mapping rule by using the delete DestinationMappingRule command.

taskbody.context: You can delete a destination mapping rule by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to delete a destination mapping rule, see .You can delete a destination mapping rule only if the rule is disabled. From the command line, you can disable destination mapping rules by editing the rules. For more information about editing destination mapping rules by using the command line, see . Alternatively, you can disable destination mapping rules by using the , see .

step.cmd: To delete a destination mapping rule, enter the following command:
step.info:
The command must be capitalized as shown.
delete DestinationMappingRule DMRnameWhere:
DMRname Specifies the name of the destination mapping rule you want to delete.

example.p: This example demonstrates deleting a destination mapping rule called exampleRule.
example.screen: delete DestinationMappingRule exampleRule The requested configuration change has completed successfully.
